item.title: Maria add a quote by Heraclitus
item.description: "The soul is dyed the color of its thoughts. Think only on those things that are in line with your principles and can bear the light of day. The content of your character is your choice. Day by day, what you do is who you become. Your integrity is your destiny - it is the light that guides your way." -- Heraclitus

item.title: Maria add a quote by Marcel Proust
item.description: "We don't receive wisdom; we must discover it for ourselves after a journey that no one can take for us or spare us." -- Marcel Proust

item.title: Maria add a quote by Socrates
item.description: "The unexamined life is not worth living." -- Socrates

item.title: Maria add a quote by Tallulah Bankhead
item.description: "Nobody can be exactly like me. Sometimes even I have trouble doing it." -- Tallulah Bankhead

item.title: Maria add a quote by Harriett Woods
item.description: "You can stand tall without standing on someone. You can be a victor without having victims" -- Harriett Woods

item.title: Maria add a quote by Andre Gide
item.description: "Believe those who are seeking the truth. Doubt those who find it." -- Andre Gide

item.title: Maria add a quote by Bessie Anderson Stanley
Maria add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Attitude is a little thing that makes a big difference." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Maria add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "Courage is what it takes to stand up and speak; courage is also what it takes to sit down and listen." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Maria add a quote by Winston S. Churchill
item.description: "We are all worms, But I do believe that I am a glow worm." -- Winston S. Churchill

item.title: Maria add a quote by Winston Churchhill
item.description: "We make a living by what we get. We make a life by what we give." -- Winston Churchhill

item.title: Maria add a quote by Henry D. Thoreau
item.description: "You cannot dream yourself into a character: you must hammer and forge yourself into one." -- Henry D. Thoreau

item.title: Maria add a quote by T.E. Lawrence
item.description: "All men dream: but not equally. Those who dream by night in the dusty recesses of their minds wake up in the day to find it was vanity, but the dreamers of the day are dangerous men, for they may act their dreams with open eyes, to make it possible." -- T.E. Lawrence

item.title: Maria add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "A person will sometimes devote all his life to the development of one part of his bodyâ€” the wishbone." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Maria add a quote by Dale Carnegie
item.description: "Remember, today is the tomorrow you worried about yesterday. " -- Dale Carnegie

item.title: Maria add a quote by Nicolas Chamfort
item.description: "A day without laughter is a day wasted." -- Nicolas Chamfort

item.title: Maria add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Creativity is knowing how to hide your sources" -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Maria add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Anyone who has never made a mistake has never tried anything new." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Maria add a quote by Martha Washington
item.description: "The greater part of our happiness or misery depends upon our dispositions, and not upon our circumstances." -- Martha Washington

item.title: Maria add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "Try not to become a man of success. Rather become a man of value." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Maria add a quote by Gautama Buddha
item.description: "Our life is shaped by our mind; we become what we think. Suffering follows an evil thought as the wheels of a cart follow the oxen that draws it. Our life is shaped by our mind; we become what we think. Joy follows a pure thought like a shadow that never leaves." -- Gautama Buddha

item.title: Maria add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Wrinkles should merely indicate where the smiles have been." -- Mark Twain

item.title: Maria add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "The only true gift is a portion of thyself." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Maria add a quote by Mahatma Gandhi
item.description: "Be the change that you wish to see in the world." -- Mahatma Gandhi

item.title: Maria add a quote by Franklin D. Roosevelt
item.description: "When you get to the end of your rope. Tie a knot and hang on." -- Franklin D. Roosevelt

item.title: Maria add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "Our greatest glory is not in never failing, but in rising up every time we fail." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson

item.title: Maria add a quote by Confucius
item.description: "Wherever you go, go with all your heart." -- Confucius

item.title: Maria add a quote by Aristotle
item.description: "Happiness is a state of activity." -- Aristotle

item.title: Maria add a quote by Thomas A. Edison
item.description: "I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work." -- Thomas A. Edison

item.title: Maria add a quote by Ralph Waldo Emerson
item.description: "It is not the length of life, but the depth." -- Ralph Waldo Emerson
